item.title: Report E-2025020093
item.description:
Report E-2025020093

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of phosphoric acid was punctured and released approximately 330-gallons of product to the asphalt pavement and nearby storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel noted that the product released into a storm drain onsite and began utilizing a vacuum trailer to remove the liquids at each storm drain between the terminal building and the retention pond. All acid impacted liquids were collected and containerized into three (3) 330-gallon totes and one (1) 275-gallon tote and staged onsite for further management.
